Key Match Events: Neco Williams with a long ball over the top, Harry Wilson with a run from deep in behind the defence, Brennan Johnson tapped in the rebound for the first goal
Harry Wilson coolly dispatched the second effort for Wales' second goal
Logi Tomasson netted twice to draw level for Iceland
Brennan Johnson was booked for a shove on Thorsteinsson and will miss Wales' next match
Pre-Game Insights: Wales have won their last four games against Iceland, most recently 3-1 in a 2014 friendly
Iceland have won only one of their previous seven meetings with Wales (one draw, five defeats), a 1-0 home win in 1984 in a World Cup qualifier
Post-Match Reflections: Craig Bellamy continues his unbeaten run as Wales boss
Wales boss Craig Bellamy admits he is free to pick Rangers forward Tom Lawrence
Joe Rodon confident Wales can handle ‘massive loss’ of Ethan Ampadu
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in cold conditions in Reykjavik
Iceland's intense press and substitutions saw them turn the game around in the second half
Wales were clinging on to earn a good point
Others: The match was a comeback draw for Iceland, with the hosts scoring two goals in the second half to draw level
